subject: History
title: Why Rome Really Fell
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Rome Really Fell.

hook.text: In 476 AD, the last Roman emperor was deposed by a barbarian. But Rome's fall started centuries earlier.

buildup.text: Historians have proposed over 200 theories: lead poisoning, Christianity, inflation, military decay.

discovery.text: The empire simply grew too large to govern. Borders stretched from Britain to Iraqâ€”impossible logistics.

twist.text: The Eastern Roman Empire didn't fall. Byzantium survived another 1,000 years until 1453.

climax.text: Rome didn't collapse in a day. It eroded gradually, and people barely noticed their world changing.

quiz.question: What happened to the Eastern Roman Empire after 476 AD?
options: It fell at the same time as the West
It survived as Byzantium for another 1,000 years
It was immediately conquered by the Persians
